entry.title: Set profile to require login on machine and utilized 2 factor authentication
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open Chrome and select profile 2. Each profile can be opened freely
# Problem Description In office or shared workstation environment, we might need to access our own profile that we sync in cloud and keep it there for convenient. But it was unsafe to left it there and could be access without any restriction
I wish I could specified that, in that machine, some of profile need to login with 2 factor verification from my phone. So I can open my profile, click yes button on my phone, and start working. But no one can open my profile on chrome in that machine without my approval
It should do this process every time the chrome was opened for each profile. So we can conveniently close the chrome and secure our profile on the machine. And using 2factor is also more convenient and more secure than password
# Summary Set profile to require login on machine and utilized 2 factor authentication
# Custom Questions #### Please select a label to classify your issue: Type-Feature - Request for new or improved features
# Additional Data Category: Other \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Interest Group joined at Chrome is not available for the Auction executed on WebView
entry.content:
Protected Audience API is available at both webView & chrome. However, having an Interest Group joined at Chrome browser, that IG was not available at the Protected Audience Auction triggered within WebView .
This is essential since there are Ads displayed on WebView where Auction is required to run.
NOTE: we have followed google guideline and did verify that web view does support joining Protected Audience Interest Groups and running a Protected Audience Auction (as detailed at https://developers.google.com/privacy-sandbox/relevance/protected-audience-api#detect_feature_support).

entry.title: The phone does not respond after OTA to the target version, restart
WeakRef has slow performance. & degrades runtime performance on NodeJS & Deno
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. See https://github.com/btakita/weakref-benchmark 2. git close & npm i 3. node ./index.js & node ./WeakValueMap.js 4. bun ./index.js & bun ./WeakValueMap.js
# Problem Description Instantiating `WeakRef` in a benchmark causes a dramatic degradation of runtime performance. `WeakRef` on Nodejs & Deno underperforms bun. Bun uses JavascriptCore. In the WeakValueMap.js benchmark, `WeakRef` performed the best with Bun. With NodeJS & Deno, `WeakMap` performed the best. Should V8 have a similar performance profile to JavascriptCore in these benchmarks?
## WeakValueMap.js
Each benchmark includes 1000 set & 1000 get ops.
``` bun ./WeakValueMap.js WeakMap x 33,849 ops/sec ±0.82% (95 runs sampled) FinalizationRegistry x 21,919 ops/sec ±1.63% (93 runs sampled) WeakRef x 68,214 ops/sec ±1.98% (91 runs sampled) WeakValueMap x 7,224 ops/sec ±1.75% (86 runs sampled) Fastest is WeakRef ```
``` node ./WeakValueMap.js WeakMap x 20,373 ops/sec ±0.44% (96 runs sampled) FinalizationRegistry x 13,921 ops/sec ±1.63% (88 runs sampled) WeakRef x 1,517 ops/sec ±17.78% (19 runs sampled) WeakValueMap x 722 ops/sec ±15.36% (81 runs sampled) Fastest is WeakMap ```
``` deno run ./WeakValueMap.js ✅ Granted all read access. WeakMap x 18,898 ops/sec ±0.52% (69 runs sampled) FinalizationRegistry x 12,827 ops/sec ±2.11% (62 runs sampled) WeakRef x 1,454 ops/sec ±21.63% (11 runs sampled) WeakValueMap x 651 ops/sec ±14.85% (47 runs sampled) Fastest is WeakMap ```
# Summary WeakRef has slow performance. & degrades runtime performance on NodeJS & Deno
# Additional Data Category: JavaScript \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Enable native occlusion tracking in interactive_ui_tests (and more?)
entry.content:
Currently native occlusion tracking is disabled in functional tests, via CHROME_HEADLESS. It would be nice to let it be enabled, but it's tricky because it can interfere with tests. I think it may be possible to enable it at least for interactive_ui_tests though so we should try to do that.
See also https://crbug.com/333426475.

entry.title: V8's Chromium-GPU bots provide too little coverage
entry.content:
The gpu bots on https://ci.chromium.org/p/v8/g/integration/console as supposed to catch errors that otherwise first show up on the optional GPU bots in Chromium's CQ when rolling.
Last roll ran into undetected errors, e.g.: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5442012
E.g. https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/mac_optional_gpu_tests_rel/133694/overview
Ideally the configs for V8's GPU bots should include all tests of the optional GPU tests and build/test the same way.

entry.title: Fail to reference `blink_platform_unittests` test from starlark config
entry.content:
While setting up linux-win-cross-rel builder http://b/332248571, I added `blink_platform_unittests` to the builder's starlark config.
``` ci.builder( name = "linux-win-cross-rel", ... targets = targets.bundle( targets = ["blink_platform_unittests"], additional_compile_targets = ["all"], mixins = [ "chromium-tester-service-account", "win10", "x86-64", ), ... ```
However, lucicfg generate failed as below.
``` ❯ lucicfg generate -log-level=debug ./infra/config/main.star [P2947459 15:51:26.860 generate.go:94 I] Generating configs using lucicfg v1.43.5... Traceback (most recent call last): //lib/builder_config.star:786:41: in _set_builder_config_property //lib/builder_config.star:667:51: in _targets_spec //lib/builder_config.star:907:28: in execute //lib/targets.star:964:72: in get_targets_spec //lib/targets.star:880:74: in resolve Error: local variable mixin referenced before assignment ```
You can find the diff in this CL. https://crrev.com/c/5440173
Note that other tests don't have this issue. (See also https://crrev.com/c/5442233)

entry.title: base::LinkedList should be a C++ range
entry.content:
Making `base::LinkedList` fit the requirements for a `std::ranges::bidirectional_range` would permit it to be used with the algorithms in `base::ranges`.
As far as I can tell, this just requires adding a `begin()` method to `base::LinkedList` and defining a bunch of operators and an `interator_concept` nested type on `base::LinkedNode`.

entry.title: In libsrtp, version is incorrect in README.chromium
entry.content:
According to the commit [Roll libsrtp to 94ac00d5ac..860492290f.](https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/deps/libsrtp/+/7990ca64c616b150a9cb4714601c4a3b0c84fe91) The version of libsrtp had been updated to 860492290f.
But in [the README of '/chromium/deps/libsrtp.git'](https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/deps/libsrtp/+/refs/heads/main/README.chromium), it is still:
`Version: 94ac00d5ac6409e3f6409e4a5edfcdbdaa7fdabe`

entry.title: Side panels aren't opening on cloud top / remote desktop
entry.content:
Chrome Version: (copy from chrome://version) Lacros Version (if applicable): (copy from chrome://version) OS: (e.g. Win10, MacOS 10.12, etc...)
Note: This issue is likely due to animation being disabled on remote desktop connections.
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) Open new tab page (2) Click on the customize Chrome button
What is the expected result? Customize Chrome side panel shows up
What happens instead? Customize Chrome doesn't show up, though the toolbar icon appears.

entry.title: paint_op_raster_fuzzer: Timeout in paint_op_raster_fuzzer
entry.content:
Detailed Report: https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=4850677026062336
Fuzzing Engine: libFuzzer Fuzz Target: paint_op_raster_fuzzer Job Type: libfuzzer_chrome_asan Platform Id: linux
Crash Type: Timeout (exceeds 60 secs) Crash Address: Crash State: paint_op_raster_fuzzer
Sanitizer: address (ASAN)
Regressed: https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=libfuzzer_chrome_asan&range=1283876:1283906
Reproducer Testcase: https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=4850677026062336
Issue filed automatically.
See https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/testing/libfuzzer/reproducing.md for instructions on reproducing this bug locally.

entry.title: Remove deprovisioned devices from https://admin.google.com/ac/chrome/devices/
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. go to https://admin.google.com/ac/chrome/devices/ 2. deprovision a device 3. no option to delete deprovisioned device.

entry.title: Support WebNN API validation tests run on all backends
entry.content:
Current WebNN API validation tests are only run for the XNNPACK backend, we need support run them for all backend.
This request was raised at the CL reviewing on https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5354988. Thanks @asully@chromium.org!

entry.title: 100ms delay between pointermove events
entry.content:
Android device name: Pixel 8
Android OS version: 14
Android System WebView version: 123.0.6312.99
Application: any
Steps to reproduce:
1. Open https://codesandbox.io/p/sandbox/clever-shape-8ppngt in a webview (e.g. send it to yourself via Messenger) 2. Drag a few times
Expected result: 16-17ms delay
Actual result: 16-100ms delay (avg ~50ms)
Did this work before? (last working WebView version, or N/A) Unsure
Additional info: This issue doesn't occur in Chrome.
I found this issue when I noticed my gestures often lagged for the first frame. E.g. for a swipe gesture, the animation wouldn't begin until ~100ms after you start swiping. I'm using @use-gesture, also created an issue here: https://github.com/pmndrs/use-gesture/issues/662

entry.title: Google Meets wont work in Chrome despite having permissions and being up todate
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open Chrome 2. Create Google Meets meeting (either instant, and scheduled) 3. Try to join
# Problem Description Google Meets loads the join page for a second or two, but before you can click join the page refreshes and says 'aw snap' citing error code 5. Reloading from that page replicates the same issue until you see the 'send feedback page' where it suggests that I try incognito (doesn't work) restart chrome (doesn't work) restart computer (doesn't work) or close all other tabs (doesn't work). I've even gone so far as to manually ensure Chrome is up to date, my cookies/browsing history is totally deleted, and still nothing works.
# Additional Comments Permissions are enabled for Chrome for both microphone and camera
# Summary Google Meets wont work in Chrome despite having permissions and being up todate
# Custom Questions #### How much crashed? The whole browser
#### Is it a problem with a plugin? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: Crashes \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: inset-area not flipping as expected
entry.content:
URL: https://codepen.io/una/pen/jOJRpMz
Code being tested: ``` inset-area: bottom; position-try-options: flip-block; ```
The second tooltip initially positions itself above the text as expected. However, it should flip when there isn't enough available space, but it does not. When I use `top: anchor(bottom);` for positioning instead of `inset-area: bottom`, it flips as expected, so I think this is a bug in how `inset-area` is interacting with `position-try-options`.

entry.title: media_pipeline_integration_fuzzer: Integer-overflow in mov_read_seek
entry.content:
Detailed Report: https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=4867879125057536
Fuzzing Engine: libFuzzer Fuzz Target: media_pipeline_integration_fuzzer Job Type: libfuzzer_chrome_ubsan Platform Id: linux
Crash Type: Integer-overflow Crash Address: Crash State: mov_read_seek av_seek_frame media::AVSeekFrame
Sanitizer: undefined (UBSAN)
Regressed: https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=libfuzzer_chrome_ubsan&range=857103:866748
Reproducer Testcase: https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=4867879125057536
Issue filed automatically.
See https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/testing/libfuzzer/reproducing.md for instructions on reproducing this bug locally.

entry.title: Upgrade instrumented libraries from Focal to Noble
entry.content: This is a tracking issue for the bi-annual instrumented libraries upgrade. The latest Ubuntu LTS is releasing this month (24.04 Noble). The plan is to upgrade from 20.04 (past 22.04) to 24.04.
